channel.title: Portforwarding.... :'(
channel.description:
ok, first i want to let you all know, i have been coding private servers since about january of 2007, so im not a noob, another thing, i know(knew) how to portfoward, it just wont let me know, i will show you in pics everything i did, witch should be 99% right, im obviously missing something that i dont know about. and i would be asking bellsouth about this but apparently it costs monney to get intuch with them. my problem, either a. or b. a. ports wont forward, b. firewall isnt unblocking no-ip?
lets start with the pics.
1. click define custom service.
[IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/2myt9ok.jpg[/img]
2. click port forwarding and it leads to this. put a service name, and fill in ports how you want it. make sure tcp is checked.
[IMG]http://i43.tinypic.com/214cpyh.jpg[/img]
then click done. now enable it, simple as that.
[IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/2n7mqg3.jpg[/img]
ok. now with no-ip. the usual set up. u should already know how it looks,
[IMG]http://i44.tinypic.com/23u6knt.jpg[/img]
and for windows firewall, here is how i have it set up.
[IMG]http://i43.tinypic.com/adf1b5.jpg[/img]
well thats it, can someone tell me what im doing wrong? my server is running, still it doesnt seem to work. i have tried adding it to the server status list, says its not up. i have also put the ip and port in my own little server status list and it says its offline as well, and yeh pretty much idk what to do anymore, if u would like to try it urself my server will be running just about all day, being the fact that it doesnt lag my computer when NO ONE CAN GET ON! :P the ip is up there if u would like to try. please help? :)

item.title: Portforwarding.... :'(
item.dc:creator: @hat_trix hat trix
item.description:
@hat_trix wrote:

ok, first i want to let you all know, i have been coding private servers since about january of 2007, so im not a noob, another thing, i know(knew) how to portfoward, it just wont let me know, i will show you in pics everything i did, witch should be 99% right, im obviously missing something that i dont know about. and i would be asking bellsouth about this but apparently it costs monney to get intuch with them.
my problem, either a. or b.
a. ports wont forward,
b. firewall isnt unblocking no-ip?

lets start with the pics.

  1. click define custom service.

  1. click port forwarding and it leads to this. put a service name, and fill in ports how you want it. make sure tcp is checked.

214cpyh.jpg728Ã—141

then click done.
now enable it, simple as that.

ok. now with no-ip. the usual set up. u should already know how it looks,

and for windows firewall, here is how i have it set up.

well thats it, can someone tell me what im doing wrong?
my server is running, still it doesnt seem to work. i have tried adding it to the server status list, says its not up. i have also put the ip and port in my own little server status list and it says its offline as well, and yeh pretty much idk what to do anymore, if u would like to try it urself my server will be running just about all day, being the fact that it doesnt lag my computer when NO ONE CAN GET ON! the ip is up there if u would like to try. please help?
